DOC.detailed_description: The Atherosclerosis Risk Communities Study ( ARIC ) , sponsor National Heart , Lung Blood Institute ( NHLBI ) , prospective epidemiologic study conduct four U.S. community . ARIC design investigate etiology natural history atherosclerosis , etiology clinical atherosclerotic disease , variation cardiovascular risk factor , medical care disease race , gender , location , date . ARIC include two part : Cohort Component Community Surveillance Component . The Cohort Component begin 1987 , ARIC field center randomly select recruit cohort sample approximately 4,000 individual age 45-64 defined population community . A total 15,792 participant receive extensive examination , include medical , social , demographic data . These participant reexamine every three year first screen ( baseline ) occur 1987-89 , second 1990-92 , third 1993-95 , fourth last exam 1996-98 . Follow-up occurs yearly telephone maintain contact participant assess health status cohort . In Community Surveillance Component , currently ongoing , four community investigate determine community-wide occurrence hospitalize myocardial infarction coronary heart disease death men woman age 35-84 year . Hospitalized stroke investigate cohort participant .
